item.title: Who Were Your Millionth-Great-Grandparents?
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Our pre-human ancestors are back there somewhere in the deep time that makes up Earth's braided history of life and change — and we are the tip of the spear moving that life forward, says Adam Frank.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - Our pre-human ancestors are back there somewhere in the deep time that makes up Earth's braided history of life and change — and we are the tip of the spear moving that life forward, says Adam Frank. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/01/540792411/who-were-your-millionth-great-grandparents

item.title: Country Music And Brain Research Come Together At Nashville Summer Camp
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Researchers in Nashville are tapping into a country music camp to learn more about Williams Syndrome, a rare genetic disorder. Many people who have it love music but don't know why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Researchers in Nashville are tapping into a country music camp to learn more about Williams Syndrome, a rare genetic disorder. Many people who have it love music but don't know why. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/31/540553819/country-music-and-brain-research-come-together-at-nashville-summer-camp

item.title: To Help Keep Sturgeon Sustainable, Farm And Fishery Work Together
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Because demand for seafood is rising and wild stocks are not, a hatchery owner in Canada is hoping his model of "responsible agriculture" can keep the prized fish both on the menu and in the water.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Because demand for seafood is rising and wild stocks are not, a hatchery owner in Canada is hoping his model of "responsible agriculture" can keep the prized fish both on the menu and in the water. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/31/539591489/to-help-keep-sturgeon-sustainable-farm-and-fishery-work-together

item.title: Scientists Edge Closer To Elusive Lab Test For Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Stanford University scientists have found an array of proteins in the blood whose levels correlate closely with the severity of symptoms of the mysterious illness that's increasingly known as ME/CFS.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Stanford University scientists have found an array of proteins in the blood whose levels correlate closely with the severity of symptoms of the mysterious illness that's increasingly known as ME/CFS. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/31/540565526/scientists-edge-closer-to-elusive-lab-test-for-chronic-fatigue-syndrome

item.title: Why We All Scream When We Get Ice Cream Brain Freeze
item.description: July 31, 2017 - When temperatures soar, there's nothing like a frozen treat to take off the edge. But if we dive in too fast, our brains are thrown for a distressing and sometimes painful loop. Here's why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - When temperatures soar, there's nothing like a frozen treat to take off the edge. But if we dive in too fast, our brains are thrown for a distressing and sometimes painful loop. Here's why. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/31/540062185/why-we-all-scream-when-we-get-ice-cream-brain-freeze

item.title: New Florida Law Lets Residents Challenge School Textbooks
item.description: July 31, 2017 - The new bill was pushed by a conservative group critical of the way evolution, climate change and government were being taught in Florida schools.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - The new bill was pushed by a conservative group critical of the way evolution, climate change and government were being taught in Florida schools. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/540041860/new-florida-law-lets-residents-challenge-school-textbooks

item.title: Sperm Counts Plummet In Western Men, Study Finds
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Data from nearly 43,000 men around the world found that sperm counts dropped by more than half in Western countries. It could reflect a decline in health overall, scientists say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Data from nearly 43,000 men around the world found that sperm counts dropped by more than half in Western countries. It could reflect a decline in health overall, scientists say. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/539517210/sperm-counts-plummet-in-western-men-study-finds

item.title: Scientists Still Seek A Reliable DUI Test For Marijuana
item.description: July 30, 2017 - Coloradans can get arrested for driving while stoned. But with no good roadside tools, officers' determinations are more subjective than for alcohol DUIs. Scientists hope to find chemical markers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 30, 2017 - Coloradans can get arrested for driving while stoned. But with no good roadside tools, officers' determinations are more subjective than for alcohol DUIs. Scientists hope to find chemical markers. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/30/523004450/scientists-still-seek-a-reliable-dui-test-for-marijuana

item.title: When Your Hand Has A Mind Of Its Own
item.description:
July 29, 2017 - What happens when you think and how you act don't align? We tell the story of a woman diagnosed with what's known as "alien hand syndrome."
- http://www.npr.org/2017/07/29/540214710/when-your-hand-has-a-mind-of-its-own
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 29, 2017 - What happens when you think and how you act don't align? We tell the story of a woman diagnosed with what's known as "alien hand syndrome." http://www.npr.org/2017/07/29/540214710/when-your-hand-has-a-mind-of-its-own

item.title: From Rats To Humans, A Brain Knows When It Can't Remember
item.description: July 28, 2017 - When we see a familiar face, we know instantly if we can remember that person's name. That's because the human brain has an ability called metamemory. Looks like rats may have that higher power, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - When we see a familiar face, we know instantly if we can remember that person's name. That's because the human brain has an ability called metamemory. Looks like rats may have that higher power, too. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/28/539761740/from-rats-to-humans-a-brain-knows-when-it-cant-remember

item.title: A Newspaperman Looks Back On A 77-Year Career
item.description: July 28, 2017 - David Perlman, age 98, talks with Steve Inskeep about his career as a science writer as he gets ready to retire from the San Francisco Chronicle after 77 years.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - David Perlman, age 98, talks with Steve Inskeep about his career as a science writer as he gets ready to retire from the San Francisco Chronicle after 77 years. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/28/539945623/a-newspaperman-looks-back-on-a-77-year-career

item.title: 'An Inconvenient Sequel' Is An Effective, Cautiously Optimistic, 'I Told You So'
item.description: July 27, 2017 - In 2006, Al Gore issued a forceful warning about the threat of climate change in An Inconvenient Truth. He's followed it up with a sequel that shows how far we've come — but with plenty of caveats.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - In 2006, Al Gore issued a forceful warning about the threat of climate change in An Inconvenient Truth. He's followed it up with a sequel that shows how far we've come — but with plenty of caveats. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/27/539734176/-an-inconvenient-sequel-is-an-effective-cautiously-optimistic-i-told-you-so

item.title: Mapping Coastal Flood Risk Lags Behind Sea Level Rise
item.description: July 27, 2017 - Federal maps help determine who on the coast must buy flood insurance, but many don't include the latest data. Maryland is now making its own flood maps, so homeowners can see if they're at risk.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - Federal maps help determine who on the coast must buy flood insurance, but many don't include the latest data. Maryland is now making its own flood maps, so homeowners can see if they're at risk. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/27/539506529/mapping-coastal-flood-risk-lags-behind-sea-level-rise

item.title: Perdue Farms Signs Up For A Chicken Welfare Revolution
item.description: July 27, 2017 - The poultry industry may be on the verge of adopting ambitious new animal-welfare standards, giving chickens more space and daylight, and even returning to older, slower-growing chicken breeds.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - The poultry industry may be on the verge of adopting ambitious new animal-welfare standards, giving chickens more space and daylight, and even returning to older, slower-growing chicken breeds. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/27/537929392/perdue-farms-signs-up-for-a-chicken-welfare-revolution

item.title: Slug Slime Inspires Scientists To Invent Sticky Surgical Glue
item.description: July 27, 2017 - The words "strong" and "inspiring" are not usually assigned to garden slugs. But slug slime inspired materials scientists to invent a new kind of adhesive that could one day help heal human wounds.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - The words "strong" and "inspiring" are not usually assigned to garden slugs. But slug slime inspired materials scientists to invent a new kind of adhesive that could one day help heal human wounds. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/27/539473673/slug-slime-inspires-scientists-to-invent-sticky-surgical-glue
